title: What do you define as a 'good' song? - Quora

response.answer_text: Just like beauty, a passion and love for music really comes from the person’s own tastes. For me, I’m a rocker and a metalhead: I love the emotion that is put into writing the music. I’m going to use my favourite band; Nothing More, as an example One of my favourite songs by them is This Is The Time (Ballast). The song’s lyrics basically represent having grudges against someone and learning to let them go. It’s a very poetic song that highlights how amazing Johnny Hawkins (vocals) is at writing music. The bass in the song is kickass: thumping and ominous, rising above the guitars and the drums as the highlight to the song, especially in the acoustic version I’ll Be Ok encompasses everything I love about lyrics. It’s soulful, heartfelt, powerful. It showcases heartbreak, grief, sorrow and pain, then learning to find solace and rise again. It’s one of the best songs I’ve ever heard. The instruments are just as amazing as Johnny’s voice. The drums are slow, not hit particularly hard and vicious, just there, in the rhythm, keeping the time. The guitar is just as slow, but the strums give the song just that added heart and emotion. In short, for me, a good song needs a meaning. It needs an appealing sound. A meh song is a song that I like for its beat but can’t connect with it. A good song goes past that with some relatable lyrics. A truly memorable song is one you get stuck in your head, and you never forget. I almost cry listening to I’ll Be Ok. Give Nothing More a spin, you won’t regret it

Good song is many things. It is music that is touching and moving, music that influences my emotions, whether the song makes me want to cry or punch someone in the face, it must be meaningful. Good song must have good lyrics, that is the first thing, all that you hear these days, “Um I screwed some chick and then got high” this is not art, therefore I do not consider this as music. Most songs that are pop and rap and hiphop, excluding Eminem’s occasionally touching songs, have no meaning what so ever. Music can not just be about sex, drugs, violence, beer, and partying. Good music must have a good beat, also the singer must have a good voice but if the lyrics are deep and meaningful, its all good. Pink Floyd and Porcupine Tree are the bands that, for me, have proven to be education. Every beat, every single word in their songs have a meaning. We need to decipher it. :)
